Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Violation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the officer's decision to deny the applicant's humanitarian and compassionate grounds for permanent residency reasonable?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant claimed hardship due to establishment in Canada and potential risks as a Jewish person in Ukraine. Officer considered employment, marriage, and lack of credible evidence.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Insufficient humanitarian and compassionate grounds found
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permanent residency on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Denied application based on insufficient H&C grounds
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Establishment in Canada, family ties, perceived risk in home country
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Employment, marriage, credibility of risk claims
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Lack of credible evidence supporting claims of risk in Ukraine
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Employment records, marital status, personal affidavit
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Humanitarian and Compassionate provisions under IRPA
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and Compassionate grounds after asylum rejection
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Personal circumstances and integration in Canada
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Standard of review for H&C decisions is reasonableness
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence to substantiate risk claims
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential hardship if returned to Ukraine
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant sought permanent residency on H&C grounds after asylum claim rejection
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer reviewed submitted documents and found them lacking
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None directly; refusal based on H&C assessment
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of corroborating evidence for risk claims
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant due to prior asylum rejection and work permit violation
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer assessed evidence as insufficient to meet H&C threshold
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No reasonable line of analysis supported granting H&C relief
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Claims not supported by objective evidence

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the immigration officer's decision to deny the applicant's humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) grounds for permanent residency reasonable?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant claimed hardship if returned to Ukraine, citing establishment in Canada and risks as a Jewish person. Officer considered employment, family ties, and lack of evidence supporting claims.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Insufficient humanitarian and compassionate grounds found
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permanent residency on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Denied application based on insufficient H&C grounds
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Establishment in Canada, family ties, perceived risk in home country
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Employment, family ties, credibility of claims
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Employment history, family relationships, personal statements
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Humanitarian and Compassionate provisions under IRPA
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and Compassionate grounds after asylum rejection
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Integration in Canada and potential hardship upon return
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Standard of review for H&C decisions is reasonableness
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence to support risk or hardship claims
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Alleged hardship and safety concerns in Ukraine
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed visa, sought permanent residency on H&C grounds after asylum claim rejection
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Submitted evidence evaluated and found inadequate
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 183 of IRPA (failure to leave by departure date)
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of documentation to verify claims
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer concluded evidence did not meet H&C threshold
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Decision fell within acceptable range of outcomes
